items.name: Mp1 - Structure of mathematical proof
points: Understand and be able to use the structure of mathematical proof.
Use methods of proof including proof by deduction and exhaustion.
Proceed logically from assumptions to conclusions.

items.name: p2 - Disproof by counterexample
points: Be able to disprove a conjecture by counterexample.

items.name: p3 - Proof by contradiction
points: Understand and be able to use proof by contradiction, including proof of irrationality of √2 and the infinity of primes.
Application to unfamiliar proofs included.

items.name: Ma1 - Vocabulary and notation
points: Know and be able to use vocabulary and notation appropriate to the subject.

items.name: Ma7 - Linear inequalities
points: Solve linear inequalities; interpret solutions graphically.
Examples include y > 2x + 3.

items.name: Quadratic inequalities
points: Solve quadratic inequalities; interpret graphically.

items.name: a14 - Proportional relationships
points: Understand and use proportional relationships and graphs.
Relationships that are directly or inversely proportional to a power or root.

items.name: a15 - Partial fractions
points: Express algebraic fractions as partial fractions.
Includes fractions with constant or linear numerators/denominators, quadratic or cubic denominators.

items.name: a16 - Rational expressions
points: Simplify rational expressions—factorising, cancelling, algebraic division.
Includes division by non-linear expressions, solving polynomial equations of degree > 4.

items.name: f3 - Definition of a function
points: Understand the definition of a function, vocabulary, notation.
Basic understanding of functions and their properties.
Notation: f(x), domain, range.

items.name: f4 - Composition of functions
points: Understand and use composition of functions, including restrictions.
Notation: (f∘g)(x).

items.name: f5 - Inverse functions
points: Understand inverse functions; their graphs, existence conditions, derivation.
Notation: f⁻¹(x).

items.name: MC1 - Graphs of functions
points: Understand and sketch graphs of functions and transformations.
Includes intercepts, symmetry, asymptotes, transformations.
Notation: Coordinates (x, y).

items.name: C2 - Completing the square
points: Use completing the square to find symmetry and turning points of quadratics.
y = ax² + bx + c.

items.name: MC7 - Graph transformations
points: Sketch graphs of transformed functions, e.g., y = af(x), y = f(x + a).
Describe how transformations affect the graph.

items.name: Mc1 - Gradient of a curve
points: Recognize the gradient of a curve equals the gradient of the tangent.
Limit of the gradient of the secant as the points approach.
Notation: dy/dx, f'(x).

items.name: c3 - Applications of derivatives
points: Use derivatives to find tangents, normals, stationary points, optimize.
Related to rates of change, maxima and minima.
Notation: dy/dx, f'(x).

items.name: c31 - Formulating differential equations
points: Formulate first-order differential equations from real-world rates of change.
Contexts include kinematics, population, demand.
Notation: dy/dx.

items.name: c32 - Solving differential equations
points: Solve first-order differential equations analytically by separation of variables.
Factor if necessary.

items.name: c33 - Interpreting solutions
points: Interpret solutions in problem contexts, understand limitations of models.
Limitations include assumptions in equations.

items.name: MH1 - Hypothesis testing process
points: Understand the hypothesis testing process and associated language.
Notation: H₀, H₁, p-value, significance level.

items.name: Mp31 - Simplifying assumptions
points: Know the language used to describe simplifying assumptions in mechanics.
